channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: @ophardy @igorsushko The bombers normally never leave Russian airspace. Some of the incoming missiles are being launched from from ships in the Caspian Sea, many hundreds of kilometers behind the border.

@Bradninchfellow @BretDevereaux Indeed: “a time” could easily be several _centuries_ or more (see: slaves of African descent), but no coercion can last forever. [I often wonder what the root causes of Chinese fear (other than centuries of pre-modern regional instability) is regarding those groups.]

@FriedrichFiles @ThomasCatt1812 @amandalhu Units called ‘Heat Recovery Ventilators’ and ‘Energy Recovery Ventilators’ are available that allow ventilation with negligible increases in energy usage by transferring heat (#HRV) or heat+humidity (#ERV) between the stale and fresh air.
@schneierblog Must be a fertile target. MSPs based on CSPs based on poor software engineering practices using unsafe tools is not a stunning foundation for stability and security.

@JohnHBillings @EliNew18 @Viking95 @BretDevereaux The Roman Empire could also be a vastly different society from one century to the next. Perhaps time/fate caught up with them, or perhaps by the end they lost sight of some of the qualities that made them once so adaptable.
@EliNew18 @BretDevereaux Entropy and time eventually kills everything, whether one is talking about salmon, sequoias, or societies.

@Bradninchfellow @BretDevereaux If a place such as Lebanon magically became homogeneous, would all of its problems disappear? (I don’t actually know, of course) Diversity is often used as a target of blame when things are not going well with a society. Blame neighboring nations for ones intractable problems?
@dobrovecer11 @BretDevereaux As I understand (from thousands of kilometers away) they are more so than many nations, both ethnically and socially.

@IainBancarz @BurtWestermeier @BretDevereaux … and at the same time too large. If Malta instead had decided to leave the EU, they likely could have obtained better trade arrangements than the UK, because their economy is so much smaller; less of an economic threat/competitor.
